question_sets.title: Chemistry - Section A

questions.text:
The \(\Delta H_f^0\) of \(CO_{2\left(g\right)},CO_{\left(g\right)},H_2O_{\left(l\right)}\) are \(-393.5, -110.5, -241.8\) \(kJ/mol\) respectively.

The standard enthalpy change (in \(kJ/mol\))  for the reaction \(CO_{2\left(g\right)}+H_{2\left(g\right)}\rightarrow CO_{\left(g\right)}+H_2O_{\left(l\right)}\) is:
For which process will \(\Delta H^\circ\:\) and \(\Delta G^\circ\) be expected to be most similar?

Directions: In the following questions, a statement of assertion (A) is followed by a statement of reason (R). Mark the correct choice as :

Assertion : Sublimation of solid is nonspontaneous.

Reason : Sublimation is an exothermic process.

  1. If both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
  2. If both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
  3. If assertion is true but reason is false.
  4. If both assertion and reason are false.

Directions: In the following questions, a statement of assertion (A) is followed by a statement of reason (R). Mark the correct choice as :

Assertion : Heat given to a system under constant volume is used up in increasing energy instead of work done.

Reason : Mechanical work done is zero at constant volume.

  1. If both assertion and reason are true and reason is the correct explanation of assertion
  2. If both assertion and reason are true but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion
  3. If assertion is true but reason is false.
  4. If both assertion and reason are false.

Combustion of glucose takes place according to the equation: 
\(C_6 H_12 O_6+6CO_2→6CO_2+6H_2 O; ∆H= -72kcal/mo\) 
How much energy will be required for the production of \(1.6g\) of glucose? (Molar mass of glucose\( = 180g/mol\))

A system is allowed to move from state A to B following path ACB by absorbing 80 J of heat energy. The work done by the system is 30J. The work done by the system in reaching state B from A is 10J through the path ADB. Which of these statements are correct?

  1. Increase in internal energy from state A to state B is \(50J\)
  2. If path ADB is being followed to reach state B\(, ∆U=50J\)
  3. If work done by the system in path AB is 20 J, the heat absorbed during path \(AB=70J\)
  4. The value \(U_C-U_A\)  is equal to \(U_D-U_B\)
  5. Heat absorbed by the system to reach B from A through path \(ADB\) is \(60J \)
The bond enthalpies of \(H-H,Cl-Cl\) and \(H-Cl\) are \(435\), \(243 \) and \(431  kJ  mol^{-1}\), respectively. The enthalpy of formation of \(HCl(g)\) will be

One mole of an ideal gas \((C_V=3  \text{cal}  mol^{-1}  K^{-1})\) occupies \(1  L\) volume at \(100  K\) (initial state, Pt. A) and \(2  L\) volume at \(200  K\) (final state, Pt. C). The change from the initial state to final state is brought about along the two paths \(ABC\) and \(ADC\). Calculate \(W\) for both the paths

\(50\) \(mL\) of water takes \(5\) minutes to evaporate from a vessel on a heater connected to an electric source which delivers \(400\) \(W\). The enthalpy of vaporisation of water is (density of water \(=1 g/mL\))

At \(298K,\) the heat of the reaction when solid magnesium sulphate \((MgSO_4)\) froms aqueous \(MgSO_4.7H_2O\) is \(-91.21kJ  mol^{-1}\) and that when solid \(MgSO_4. 7H_2O\) from aqueous \(MgSO_4. 7H_2O\) is \(13.81kJ  mol^{-1}\). The heat of reaction when seven molecules of water are added to solid magnesium sulphate is:

A sample of \(1.0 mole\) of monoatomic ideal gas is taken through a process of expansion and compression as shown in the figure. \(A(2atm, 10L), B(1atm,  20L)\) and \(C(1atm, 10L)\) are the coordinates of states A, B, and C in the given graph. Find out the value of \(\Delta\)G for the process as a whole.

Match List I (Equations) with List II (Type of processes) and select the correct option.

List I EquationsList II Type of processes
  1. \(K_p>Q\)
  1. Non-spontaneous
  1. \(\Delta G^\circ<RT \ln Q\)
  1. Equilibrium
  1. \(K_p=Q\)
  1. Spontaneous and endothermic
  1. \(T>\frac{\Delta H}{\Delta S}\)
  1. Spontaneous

question_sets.description:
MCQs with SINGLE correct option
Correct: +4,Wrong: -1, Skipped: 0

question_sets.title: Chemistry - Section B

questions.text:
Match the following:


List-I
List-II

A.

Isothermal process

P.

\(\Delta E=0\)

B.

Reversible adiabatic process

Q.

\(\Delta H=0\)

C.

Cyclic process 

R.

\(\Delta S=0\)

D.

Isochoric process 

S.

\(w=0\)


T.

\(\Delta G=0\)

Advanced Matrix Matching
ALL correct matches are selected: +4
If ANY wrong match selected: -1,

question_sets.title: Chemistry - Section C

questions.text:
Entropy changes for ideal gas are follows:

  1. Entropy change is terms of temperature and volume is given by
    \(\Delta S=nC_v\ln\frac{T_2}{T_1}+nR\ln\frac{V_2}{V_1}\)
    It is for \(n\) moles of an ideal gas from \(V_1\) to \(V_2\) when temperature changes from \(T_1\) to \(T_2\). \(C_v\) is the heat capacity at constant volume.
  2. Entropy change in terms of temperature and pressure:
    \(\Delta S=nC_p\ln\frac{T_2}{T_1}+nR\ln\frac{P_2}{P_1}\) (For \(n\) moles of gas)
    \(C_p\) is the molar heat capacity at constant pressure.

The entropy change for expansion of \(14\,g\) of nitrogen when heated from \(27^\circ C\) to \(127^\circ C\) at constant volume and constant pressure will be (in cal/degree) respectively.

(Given, \(C_v=4.94\,cal/mol\) in this temperature range)

Entropy changes for ideal gas are follows:

  1. Entropy change is terms of temperature and volume is given by
    \(\Delta S=nC_v\ln\frac{T_2}{T_1}+nR\ln\frac{V_2}{V_1}\)
    It is for \(n\) moles of an ideal gas from \(V_1\) to \(V_2\) when temperature changes from \(T_1\) to \(T_2\). \(C_v\) is the heat capacity at constant volume.
  2. Entropy change in terms of temperature and pressure:
    \(\Delta S=nC_p\ln\frac{T_2}{T_1}+nR\ln\frac{P_2}{P_1}\) (For \(n\) moles of gas)
    \(C_p\) is the molar heat capacity at constant pressure.

When two moles of an ideal gas \(\left(C_{p,m}=\frac 52R\right)\) is heated from \(300K\) to \(600K\) at constant pressure, the value of \(\Delta S\) is

question_sets.description:
MCQs with SINGLE correct option
Correct: +4,Wrong: -1, Skipped: 0

question_sets.title: Chemistry - Section D

questions.text:
\(8.21\:dm^3\text{ of }NH_3\text{ at }500\:K\text{ and }1\:atm\) expands adiabatically upto \(0.5\) \(atm\) against a constant external pressure of \(0.5\) \(atm\). (Assume that \(NH_3\) behaves as an ideal gas and vibrational degrees of freedom are inactive. \(\left(R=2\:cal\:mol^{-1}K^{-1}=0.0821\:atm\text{-lit}\:K^{-1}\:mol^{-1}\right).\)

The value of \(\frac{\left|\Delta U\right|}{15}\) (In calories) is

Carbon monoxide \((CO)\) and oxygen \((O_2)\) react according to

\(2CO(g)+O_2(g)\to 2CO_2(g)\)

Assuming that the reaction takes place and goes to completion, determine the total pressure after the valve is opened in the apparatus represented in the accompanying figure. Also assume that the temperature is fixed at \(300\,𝐾\). If you get the total pressure to be ‘\(P\)’ report the answer as \(10\times P\).

For the combustion of benzene \((C_6H_6), 1\,mole\) of benzene is taken in a vessel and its heat of reaction at constant volume is \(7000\, kCal\). This process occurs at \(300\,K\).

When benzene is combusted at constant pressure, a mass of \(100\, kilos\) is put on a piston which maintains the constant pressure. How high in metres will the piston rise?

\(10\,g\) of ice at \(0^\circ C\) are added to \(20\,g\) of water at \(90^\circ C\) in a thermally insulated flask of negligible heat capacity. If we break this process down into \(3\) distinct steps as mentioned below:

  1. ice melting and forming water
  2. raising the temperature of this water at \(0^\circ C\) to \('T'\,^\circ C\).
  3. Change of temperature of water present initially from \(90^\circ C\) to \('T'\,^\circ C\)

Find \(q_i+q_{ii}+q_{iii}+\Delta S_i+\Delta S_{ii}+\Delta S_{iii}\), where all the quantities can take a value of \(0\) or \(1\). If \(q\) is positive, then it takes a value of \(1\), if it is negative it takes a value of \(0\). \(\Delta S\) values behave similarly.

In the figure shown \(A\) is of mass \(1\:kg\) and \(B\) of mass \(2\:kg\). \(A\) moves with velocity \(3\:m/s\) and rises on \(B\) which is initially at rest. All the surfaces are smooth. By the time \(A\) reaches the highest point on \(B\), find the work done by \(A\) on \(B\) in joule

question_sets.description:
Non-Negative Integer answer
Correct: +4,Wrong: -1, Skipped: 0

question_sets.title: Chemistry - Section E

questions.text: A system is changed from an initial state to a final state by a manner such that if the same change from the initial state to the final state were made by a different path, which of the following statements are correct for \(\Delta H\) system?

options.text: will depend upon the type of path
Heat exchanged \(q\) will be same if the path is isobaric
Heat exchanged \(q\) will be different if the path is not isobaric

questions.text: For a reaction taking place in a container in equilibrium with its surroundings, the effect of temperature on its equilibrium constant \(K\) in terms of change in entropy is described by

options.text: With increase in temperature, the value of \(K\) for exothermic reaction decreases because the entropy change of the system is positive
With increase in temperature, the value of \(K\) for endothermic reaction increases because the entropy change of the system is negative
With increase in temperature, the value of \(K\) for exothermic reaction decreases because favourable change in entropy of the surroundings decreases
With increase in temperature, the value of \(K\) for endothermic reaction increases because unfavourable change in entropy of the surroundings decreases

questions.text: An ideal gas in a thermally insulated vessel at internal pressure \(=P_1\), volume \(=V_1\) and absolute temperature \(=T_1\) expands irreversibly against zero external pressure, as shown in the diagram. The final internal pressure, volume and absolute temperature of the gas are \(P_2,V_2\) and \(T_2\), respectively. For this expansion,
On the basis of the following graph (\(P\)-\(V\) graph), choose the correct statements.

options.text: The entropy change for the over all process is zero.
For the over all process \(\Delta H > \Delta E.\)

questions.text: Which of the following are correct for an isothermal reversible expansion of an ideal gas
